/* History */ - Guess we have to add "as well as" again
There was only one Sino-Indian war and thus the official name does not include 1962; I have left it outside the brackets to distinguish for people who want to know the standard name
what's with inserting all of the non-legible characters?
If we're going to write the wars this way, then we may as well remove the "as well as".
In Satyameva Jayate as well -- if we're indicating pronunciation, we might as well not do it in an ad-hoc manner.
The ē is pronounced a bit like "ay", not like "ee". It's the standard romanization used by the central government and several state governments.
In English, Jana Gana Mana is always written with a normal 'n'; reverting because the sign appears as a square in most browsers under default settings and official splg in English is Jana Gana Mana
the long e is not the right sound... it's vand-ey (sound-wise)
